meta.Summary::
MAIB Report on the investigation of the fatal man overboard from the recreational fishing boat Amy Jane Near Cadgwith, Cornwall on 4 December 2013.


On the afternoon of 4 December 2013, Christopher Newton went to sea alone from the beach at Cadgwith, Cornwall on his 3.9m long boat. Once darkness fell, friends and family became concerned that he had not returned and the alarm was raised with the coastguard. Following a search, Christopher Newton was found, semi-conscious, in the water by a commercial survey vessel and airlifted to hospital where he was later declared deceased. The boat was found 4½ days later, 35 miles east of Cadgwith.

The report found that:

 The fisherman did not have adequate safety equipment for single-handed operation,
He fell overboard (the boat was not in a collision),
The kill-cord was not used and the boat continued away from him,
He did not give anyone a firm return time nor advise them on actions to take if he was overdue,
He had no means to raise the alarm.

Report No 26/2014 | Published 18 September 2014

title: Accident Investigation Report 26/2014

Following a search, Christopher Newton was found, semi-conscious, in the water by a commercial survey vessel and airlifted to hospital where he was later declared deceased. The boat was found 4½ days later, 35 miles east of Cadgwith.

The report found that:

  • He fell overboard (the boat was not in a collision),

body:
![ASSET_TAG](#ASSET1)

  


MAIB Report on the investigation of the fatal man overboard from the recreational fishing boat Amy Jane Near Cadgwith, Cornwall on 4 December 2013.

On the afternoon of 4 December 2013, Christopher Newton went to sea alone from the beach at Cadgwith, Cornwall on his 3.9m long boat. Once darkness fell, friends and family became concerned that he had not returned and the alarm was raised with the coastguard. Following a search, Christopher Newton was found, semi-conscious, in the water by a commercial survey vessel and airlifted to hospital where he was later declared deceased. The boat was found 4½ days later, 35 miles east of Cadgwith.

The report found that:

  * The fisherman did not have adequate safety equipment for single-handed operation, 
  * He fell overboard (the boat was not in a collision),
  * The kill-cord was not used and the boat continued away from him,
  * He did not give anyone a firm return time nor advise them on actions to take if he was overdue,
  * He had no means to raise the alarm.

Report No 26/2014 | Published 18 September 2014
